qas.question: What building did Van der Rohe create for IBM?
The 330 North Wabash building served as what post World War 2?

answers.text: center of the company's research division

qas.question: The 330 North Wabash Building was recognized with what award?
IBM has towers in which cities?
IBM has worked with architects and designers such as Ludwig Mies van der Rohe, I.M. Pei, and Van der Rohe, name one  more.
What building did Eero Saarinen create for IBM?

plausible_answers.text: center of the company's research division

qas.question: What was the Somers Office Complex used for after WWII?
What award was given to recognize the Somers Office Complex?
What group gave the award to the Somers Office Complex?
In what three cities does Eero Saarinen also have his works on display?

context: Other major campus installations include towers in <a3_0><b9_0>Montreal, Paris, and Atlanta<b9_0/><a3_0/>; software labs in Raleigh-Durham, Rome, Cracow and Toronto; Johannesburg, Seattle; and facilities in Hakozaki and Yamato. The company also operates the IBM Scientific Center, Hursley House, the Canada Head Office Building, IBM Rochester, and the Somers Office Complex. The company's contributions to architecture and design, which include works by <a4_0>Eero Saarinen<a4_0/>, Ludwig Mies van der Rohe, and I.M. Pei, have been recognized. Van der Rohe's <a0_0><b5_0>330 North Wabash building in Chicago<b5_0/><a0_0/>, the original <a1_0><b6_0>center of the company's research division<b6_0/><a1_0/> post-World War II, was recognized with <b7_0>the <a2_0>1990 Honor Award<b7_0/><a2_0/> from <b8_0>the National Building Museum<b8_0/>.
